de.mrapp.android.view

Class FloatingActionButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.RelativeLayout
          • de.mrapp.android.view.FloatingActionButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class FloatingActionButton
extends android.widget.RelativeLayout
    A floating action button, which has been designed according to the Material design guidelines. Refer to http://www.google.com/design/spec/components/buttons-floating-action- button.html for further information on the Material design guidelines.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FloatingActionButton.Size
      Contains all possible sizes of a floating action button.

        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the view's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet

      • FloatingActionButton

        public FloatingActionButton(android.content.Context context,
                            android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                            int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new floating action button, which has been designed according to the Material design guidelines.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the view's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this view. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • FloatingActionButton

        public FloatingActionButton(android.content.Context context,
                            android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                            int defaultStyle,
                            int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new floating action button, which has been designed according to the Material design guidelines.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the view, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the view, as an instance of the type AttributeSet
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the preference, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults

      • getSize

        public final FloatingActionButton.Size getSize()
        Returns the floating action button's size.
        Returns:
        The floating action button's size as a value of the enum FloatingActionButton.Size. The size may either be NORMAL or SMALL

        Sets the visibility of the floating action button.
        Parameters:
        visibility - The visibility, which should be set, as an Integer value. The visibility may be View.VISIBLE, View.INVISIBLE or View.GONE
        animate - True, if changing the visibility should be animated, false otherwise
